parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: False Activation of Automatic Emergency Braking (AEB) and Collision Avoidance System (CAS)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The false activation of AEB and CAS can cause sudden and unexpected braking, leading to loss of control, accidents, or rear-end collisions, which can result in injuries or fatalities.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Overriding of Driver Input by AEB and CAS
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The AEB and CAS systems overriding the driver's input can cause loss of control, accidents, or rear-end collisions, which can result in injuries or fatalities.
A defective ABS system can cause loss of control, accidents, or rear-end collisions, which can result in injuries or fatalities.
The failure of the tire sidewall can cause a tire blowout, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and risk to the safety of others.
symptoms: No warning signs or symptoms prior to failure
decoupling groove failure on the inside edge of the steer tire.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The tire blowout can cause loss of vehicle control, accidents, and risk to the safety of others.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unintended Automatic Emergency Braking System Engagement
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unexpected activation of the automatic emergency braking system can cause the vehicle to suddenly stop, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The vehicle suddenly comes to a dead stop without warning
even when there is no obstacle or hazard in front of the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Exhaust Gas Infiltration into the Cab
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The design flaw of down-facing exhaust systems with aerodynamic panels can cause exhaust gases, including regen soot, to enter the cab, posing a health risk to drivers and potentially impairing cognitive function.
symptoms: Drivers can smell regen soot and exhaust gases while driving or idling
and may experience coughing or other health issues due to prolonged exposure.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Malfunctioning Lane Guidance and Traction Sensors
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Faulty lane guidance and traction sensors can cause false alarms, leading to unnecessary activation of safety features, such as automatic emergency braking, and potentially causing accidents or disruptions to traffic flow.
symptoms: The lane guidance sensor activates even when there is no line to guide it
and the traction sensor comes on even when there is no loss of traction.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A malfunctioning electronic logging system can lead to inaccurate records, potentially resulting in non-compliance with regulations, fines, and even accidents due to driver fatigue.
symptoms: The system fails to log hours correctly
and the system may not provide accurate records.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An faulty TPMS can lead to inaccurate tire pressure readings, potentially causing tire failure, loss of control, and accidents.
symptoms: The low tire pressure alarm sounds at incorrect pressures
and the system may not provide accurate readings.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Clutch Fan and Cruise Control Malfunction
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the clutch fan and cruise control can cause sudden loss of control, leading to accidents, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The clutch fan kicks in unexpectedly
and the vehicle may not display any warning lights.
